    NearestNeighbors.BallTree — Type.
    BallTree(data [, metric = Euclidean(), leafsize = 10]) -> balltree

    Creates a BallTree from the data using the given metric and leafsize.

    NearestNeighbors.BruteTree — Type.
    BruteTree(data [, metric = Euclidean()) -> brutetree

    Creates a BruteTree from the data using the given metric.

    NearestNeighbors.Chebyshev

    NearestNeighbors.DEBUG
    NearestNeighbors.DataFreeTree — Type.
    DataFreeTree(treetype, data[, reorderbufffer = similar(data), kwargs...]) -> datafreetree

    Creates a DataFreeTree which wraps a KDTree or BallTree. Keywords arguments are passed to their respective constructors.

    The KDTree or BallTree will be stored without a reference to the underlaying data. injectdata has to be used to re-link them to a data array before use.

    NearestNeighbors.KDTree — Type.
    KDTree(data [, metric = Euclidean(), leafsize = 10]) -> kdtree

    Creates a KDTree from the data using the given metric and leafsize. The metric must be a MinkowskiMetric.

    NearestNeighbors.injectdata — Function.
    injectdata(datafreetree, data) -> tree

    Returns the KDTree/BallTree wrapped by datafreetree, set up to use data for the points data.

    NearestNeighbors.inrange — Function.
    inrange(tree::NNTree, points, radius [, sortres=false]) -> indices

    Find all the points in the tree which is closer than radius to points. If sortres = true the resulting indices are sorted.

    NearestNeighbors.inrange_kernel!
    NearestNeighbors.inrange_point!

    NearestNeighbors.knn — Function.
    knn(tree::NNTree, points, k [, sortres=false]) -> indices, distances

    Performs a lookup of the k nearest neigbours to the points from the data in the tree. If sortres = true the result is sorted such that the results are in the order of increasing distance to the point. skip is an optional predicate to determine if a point that would be returned should be skipped.

    NearestNeighbors.knn_kernel!
    NearestNeighbors.knn_point!
